intro: Ervatamia jasminiflora, commonly known as the sweet-scented germander, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It features small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, often emitting a jasmine-like aroma. The plant has aromatic, slightly hairy leaves that are typically lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Ervatamia jasminiflora is valued in traditional medicine for its purported tonic and antispasmodic properties.
